title: Magnitude 6 . 4 earthquake strikes close Australian neighbour
message:
Vanuatu, one of Australia's closest island neighbours, has been rocked by a massive magnitude 6.4 earthquake.
The undersea quake occurred north of Port Villa, Vanuatu's capital, about 9.23am local time at a depth of 32km, the government-run Geoscience Australia portal states.
The Bureau of Meteorology has stated there is no tsunami risk to Australia.
The island nation is 3,600km off the coast of northeastern Queensland and is home to about 340,000 peopleIt follows a 6.2 magnitude earthquake occurring about 95km from Luganville earlier this month.
Vanuatu, one of Australia's closest island neighbours, has been rocked by a massive magnitude 6.4 earthquake
event_breakdown:
Vanuatu:
- Magnitude 6.4 earthquake north of Port Villa.  Depth 32km.
- Shallow 6.2 earthquake just north of Luganville earlier this month

title: Strong earthquake hits Vanuatu but no reports of tsunami risk or damage
message:
A strong earthquake has struck the South Pacific Island nation of Vanuatu but there are no tsunami warnings or immediate reports of damageStrong earthquake hits Vanuatu but no reports of tsunami risk or damageMELBOURNE, Australia -- A strong earthquake struck the South Pacific Island nation of Vanuatu on Sunday, but there were no tsunami warnings or immediate reports of damage.
Its epicenter was 83 kilometers (52 miles) northwest of the capital, Port Vila, at a depth of 29 kilometers (18 miles).
The Hawaii-based Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said there was no risk of the quake causing a tsunami.
“It was heavy and slow, but didn’t do any damage at all in Port Vila,” Apuary told The Associated Press.
A magnitude 7.7 earthquake a year ago caused a small tsunami to wash ashore at Vanuatu but no damage was reported.
event_breakdown:
.
- A strong earthquake struck the South Pacific Island nation of Vanuatu on Sunday, March 13, 2022.
- The epicenter was 83 km (52 miles) northwest of the capital, Port Vila, at a depth of 29 km (18 miles).
- The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said there was no risk of the quake causing a tsunami.
- Vanuatu's National Disaster Management Office director, Peter Korisa, said the quake was felt and caused items in a house to move. 
- Vanuatu doesn't seem to have suffered serious damage after the earthquake.

title: Strong earthquake strikes near Vanuatu : USGS
message:
SYDNEY, May 26, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - A magnitude 6.3 earthquake hit Pacificnation Vanuatu on Sunday, the United States Geological Survey said, but wasnot expected to generate a tsunami.
Striking near a sparsely populated cluster of islands, the Pacific TsunamiWarning Centre said "the earthquake is not expected to generate a tsunami".
There were no immediate reports of damage in Vanuatu.
Earthquakes are common in Vanuatu, a low-lying archipelago of 320,000 peoplethat straddles the seismic Ring of Fire.
The Ring of Fire is an arc of intense tectonic activity that stretchesthrough Southeast Asia and across the Pacific basin.
event_breakdown: Earthquake, Tsunami

title: Earthquake of magnitude 6 . 4 strikes Vanuatu Islands
message:
NEW DELHI: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck the Pacific nation of Vanuatu on Sunday, according to the United States Geological Survey ( USGS ).
The quake, which occurred at 9:23 am local time, was centered in the ocean approximately 83 kilometers (51 miles) northwest of Vanuatu's capital, Port Vila, at a depth of about 29 kilometers (18 miles).The Pacific Tsunami Warning Centre stated that the earthquake was not expected to generate a tsunami.
There have been no immediate reports of damage.Vanuatu, an archipelago with a population of 320,000, frequently experiences earthquakes as it is situated on the seismic Ring of Fire.
This arc of intense tectonic activity extends through Southeast Asia and across the Pacific basin.

title: Pre - trial detention ordered for suspects in Chile fire
message:
A Chilean court ordered the pre-trial detention of two men accused of starting a massive fire earlier this year that left 137 people dead in the resort city of Vina del Mar.
Police had announced Friday the arrests of volunteer firefighter Ignacio Mondaca, 22, and forestry official Franco Pinto, who have been ordered held behind bars for six months.
Prosecutors said they had access to evidence the shows both men acted deliberately and that they had knowledge about the optimal weather conditions to start fires.
The fires were the worst natural disaster to strike the South American nation since the 2010 earthquake and tsunami that left more than 500 dead.
The extreme weather in Chile has also been exacerbated by the El Niño climate phenomenon, which warms the Pacific Ocean.
event_breakdown:
Natural Disasters Events:
- 2010 earthquake and tsunami,
- 2017 Chilean wildfires
- 2017 Por que No, Chile wildfires
- Chilean 2017 August wildfires

title: New  PDS Red Flag Warning to help assess wildfire risks in Oregon and California
message:
The National Weather Service in Medford, Oregon has announced a new product for the 2024 wildfire season.
“In conjunction with other offices covering the state of California, we began testing the usage of "particularly dangerous situation" or PDS Red Flag Warnings,” the agency announced on social media.
“This year, we will begin issuing PDS Red Flag Warnings for Oregon and California as necessary.”NWS Medford says they will issue the PDS Red Flag Warnings when these conditions are met.
“This year, we will begin issuing PDS Red Flag Warnings for Oregon and California as necessary.
PDS Red Flag Warnings are expected to be rare, which is why we haven't actually issued any yet.
event_breakdown:
1. Wildfire season in California.
2. New products for the 2024 wildfire season.
3. Particularly dangerous situation (PDS) Red Flag Warnings for Oregon and California.

title: LIVE : More Severe weather moving across Oklahoma
message:
TechCrunchAccurate weather forecasts are critical to industries like agriculture, and they're also important to help prevent and mitigate harm from inclement weather events or natural disasters.
In 2012, Manolis Nikiforakis, Stratos Theodorou and Nikos Tsiligaridis launched an app that allowed community members to provide grassroots weather updates.
Now, they are building WeatherXM, a network of community-monitored weather stations that are collecting and sharing local weather data through systems built on the blockchain.
event_breakdown:
1. Weather forecasting can help prevent and mitigate harm from inclement weather events or natural disasters.
2. In 2012, Manolis Nikiforakis, Stratos Theodorou and Nikos Tsiligaridis launched an app that allowed community members to provide grassroots weather updates.
3. Now, they are building WeatherXM, a network of community-monitored weather stations that are collecting and sharing local weather data through systems built on the blockchain.

title: 6 . 3 - magnitude quake hits Vanuatu - Xinhua
message:
SUVA, May 26 (Xinhua) -- An earthquake with a magnitude of 6.3 jolted 83 km north-northwest of Port-Vila, capital of Vanuatu at 09:23 local time on Sunday, the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) said.
There were no immediate reports of casualty or damage.
The epicenter, with a depth of 29.2 km, was determined to be at 17.109 degrees south latitude and 167.884 degrees east longitude, according to the USGS.
The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center did not immediately issue a tsunami warning based on the quake.
Pacific island countries such as Fiji, Tonga and Vanuatu lie on the so-called Pacific "Ring of Fire," an arc of earthquake and volcanic zones where continental plates collide, producing frequent seismic activities.
event_breakdown:
Events:
- Earthquake
  * Date: May 26, 2019
  * Location: 83 km north-northwest of Port-Vila, Vanuatu
  * Magnitude: 6.3 (USGS)
  * Depth: 29.2 km
  * Intensities: No immediate reports of casualty or damage
- No report on tsunami warning

title: Strong earthquake hits Vanuatu but no reports of tsunami risk or damage
message:
MELBOURNE, Australia (AP) — A strong earthquake has struck the South Pacific Island nation of Vanuatu but there are no tsunami warnings or immediate reports of damage.
The U.S. Geological Survey says the quake had a preliminary magnitude of 6.3 when it hit Sunday morning.
Its epicenter was 52 miles northwest of the capital Port Vila at a depth of 18 miles.
The Hawaii-based Pacific Tsunami Warning Center says there was no risk of the quake causing a tsunami.

title: Researchers forecast concerning wildfire conditions in coming decades :  Even regions with a temperate climate will need to prepare
message:
Researchers forecast concerning wildfire conditions in coming decades: 'Even regions with a temperate climate will need to prepare'Wildfires are about to become everyone's problem, according to Phys.org.
This means the increased wildfire risk can be attributed to human-induced warming from that point forward.
"Even regions with a temperate climate will need to prepare for wildfires in the future," said Julia Miller, a Ph.D. student who authored the study.
Why is increased wildfire risk concerning?
The study predicts that the number of days with "high" wildfire danger will more than double by 2100.
event_breakdown:
Natural disaster events refer to events that have geographical locations. Here is the list of events mentioned in this text:

- Increased wildfire risk
- Increased number of days with "high" wildfire danger by 2100

title: Chile : Volunteer firefighter , forestry official accused of setting deadly wildfires that killed 130
message:
Implicated so far is volunteer firefighter Francisco Ignacio Mondaca, along with Francisco Pinto, an official from Chile’s National Forestry Corporation (CONAF), part of the Agriculture ministry that is responsible for preventing forest fires.
On Saturday, the prosecutor’s office in Valparaiso, a coastal city close to areas hardest hit by the fires, said that both suspects were in pre-trial detention.
Authorities say Mondaca, the firefighter, carried out the plot, while citing the CONAF official as the mastermind behind it.
The fires were the worst natural disaster to strike the South American nation since the 2010 earthquake and tsunami that left more than 500 dead.
AdvertisementThe extreme weather in Chile has also been exacerbated by the El Niño climate phenomenon, which warms the Pacific Ocean.
event_breakdown: The wildfires in Chile in 2017, (location: Chile) - Which killed over 100 people, displaced nearly 200,000 others and torched 1.5 million hectares (3.7 million acres) by early 2017 - making it the worst forest fires in the history of Chile.

title: A significant severe weather event possible on Sunday
message:
But everyone needs to be very vigilant and weather aware as we head into our Sunday as we have the potential of a SIGNIFICANT severe weather event across the entire state of Kentucky.
ALL modes of severe weather are possible, so let’s break down it down threat by threat.
We start out with our number one threat which is an increased risk for HURRICANE FORCE winds of 75mph+.
You’ll also noticed we have an increased risk for flash flooding as these storms drop a lot of rain.
For that reason, the WPC (Weather Prediction Center) has the entire area in a level 2 risk for flash flooding.
event_breakdown:
Here are the natural-disasters events in the text:
- Hurricane force winds of 75mph+
- Flash flooding

title: Heavy downpours on the way with thunderstorms set to lash England and Wales
message:
Slow-moving showers and thunderstorms are expected to develop on Sunday afternoon, with 20-30mm of rain due to hit.
Hail and lightning strikes may also occur, with people warned to expect possible flooding, travel delays and power cuts.
The Met Office has issued a yellow warning from midday until 8pm across much of central and northern England and the north east of Wales.
“So I’d say definitely keep an eye out on that.
A mix of “sunshine and showers” will be the case for many on bank holiday Monday, with drier conditions possible in parts of Wales, Northern Ireland and south-west England in the afternoon.

title: Tornado Warning Issued for Parts of Oklahoma Amid Severe Storms , as Heat Scorches South Texas
message:
OKLAHOMA CITY—Scattered severe storms continued in Oklahoma and forecasters issued a tornado warning for some parts of the state Saturday night, as some heat records were broken during the day in South Texas and people were warned of triple-digit temperatures over the long holiday weekend.
Excessive heat, especially for May, was the danger in South Texas, where the heat index was forecast to approach 120 degrees Fahrenheit (49 degrees Celsius) in some spots during the weekend.
Red Flag fire warnings were also in place in West Texas, all of New Mexico and parts of Oklahoma, Arizona and Colorado.
The storm system causing the severe weather was expected to move east as the Memorial Day weekend continues, bringing rain that could delay the Indianapolis 500 auto race Sunday in Indiana and more severe storms in Illinois, Indiana, Missouri and Kentucky.
The risk of severe weather moves into North Carolina and Virginia on Monday, forecasters said.
event_breakdown: Severe weather, heat, fire danger, rainfall

“So I’d say definitely keep an eye out on that.
A mix of “sunshine and showers” will be the case for many on bank holiday Monday, with drier conditions possible in parts of Wales, Northern Ireland and south-west England in the afternoon.

title: Driver Dies : Driver dies after auto falls in drain | Mangaluru News
message:
Slopes of new city roads not helping water drain into Vaigai: Master planMadurai faces continuing waterlogging issues due to inadequate storm water drains and maintenance.
The lack of proper gradient towards Vaigai river worsens flooding even before the monsoon arrives.
Mangaluru: A driver died after the autorickshaw he was driving fell into a stormwater drain near Yamuna Paradise Apartment in Kottara .
City police commissioner Anupam Agrawal said that at 11 pm on Friday, Deepak Acharya died after the vehicle he was riding fell into a drain.
Padupanambur in Mulki in Dakshina Kannada recorded 192mm rainfall, while Hejamady and Thenka in Kaup in Udupi district received 191.5 mm and 189.5 mm rainfall, respectively.
event_breakdown:
Events from the text:
1. Waterlogging issues in Madurai due to inadequate storm water drains.
2. Lack of proper gradient towards Vaigai river worsening flooding in Madurai.
3. Driver died after the autorickshaw he was driving fell into a stormwater drain in Kottara, Mangaluru.
4. Padupanambur in Mulki in Dakshina Kannada recorded 192mm rainfall.
5. Hejamady in Kaup in Udupi district recorded 191.5mm rainfall.
6. Thenka in Kaup in Udupi district recorded 189.5 mm rainfall.

title: Tornado warning issued for parts of Oklahoma amid severe storms as heat scorches South Texas
message:
OKLAHOMA CITY -- Scattered severe storms continued in Oklahoma and forecasters issued a tornado warning for some parts of the state Saturday night, as some heat records were broken during the day in South Texas and people were warned of triple-digit temperatures over the long holiday weekend.
A following post at 10:05 p.m. said storms had exited the area but warned of a storm moving across north Texas that could affect portions of south central Oklahoma.
Excessive heat, especially for May, was the danger in South Texas, where the heat index was forecast to approach 120 degrees Fahrenheit (49 degrees Celsius) in some spots during the weekend.
Red Flag fire warnings were also in place in West Texas, all of New Mexico and parts of Oklahoma, Arizona and Colorado.
The risk of severe weather moves into North Carolina and Virginia on Monday, forecasters said.

- Severe storms in Oklahoma 
- High temperatures in South Texas

title: Severe storms to strike eastern half of U . S . this Memorial Day weekend as heat hits the South
message:
Dangerous severe storms will sweep across the eastern half of the U.S. this Memorial Day weekend, affecting a number of major cities from Saturday to Monday.
Thunderstorms over Oklahoma and Texas are expected to push east into Missouri and Iowa overnight.
The storms will finish off on the East Coast on Monday, with a slight risk of severe weather issued to the mid-Atlantic.
Southern heatThe South will also be facing extreme heat over Memorial Day weekend.
Extreme fire conditionsFour million are under alerts for critical fire weather conditions across the high and southern Plains from Colorado to Texas, including Albuquerque and Santa Fe, New Mexico; and El Paso, Texas.
event_breakdown:
The dangerous severe storms sweeping across the eastern half of the U.S., are expected to occur in the following locations:

- Oklahoma and Texas
- Missouri and Iowa
- The Mid-Atlantic

Additionally, extreme heat is expected across the South and extreme fire conditions are expected across the high and southern Plains from Colorado to Texas. These locations include:

- Albuquerque, New Mexico
- Santa Fe, New Mexico
- El Paso, Texas

Some of these locations, such as Missouri, Iowa the Mid-Atlantic and the regions from Colorado to Texas will be affected both by a high heat risk and fire danger.

title: Tornado warning issued for parts of Oklahoma amid severe storms , as heat scorches South Texas
message:
OKLAHOMA CITY (AP) — Scattered severe storms continued in Oklahoma and forecasters issued a tornado warning for some parts of the state Saturday night, as some heat records were broken during the day in South Texas and people were warned of triple-digit temperatures over the long holiday weekend.
A following post at 10:05 p.m. said storms had exited the area but warned of a storm moving across north Texas that could affect portions of south central Oklahoma.
Excessive heat, especially for May, was the danger in South Texas, where the heat index was forecast to approach 120 degrees Fahrenheit (49 degrees Celsius) in some spots during the weekend.

The risk of severe weather moves into North Carolina and Virginia on Monday, forecasters said.

title: Heavy downpours on the way with thunderstorms set to lash England and Wales
message:
More than an inch of rain could fall in just one hour as thunderstorms lash parts of England and Wales, forecasters have warned.
Slow-moving showers and thunderstorms are expected to develop on Sunday afternoon, with 20-30mm of rain due to hit.
Hail and lightning strikes may also occur, with people warned to expect possible flooding, travel delays and power cuts.
The Met Office has issued a yellow warning from midday until 8pm across much of central and northern England and the north east of Wales.
A mix of “sunshine and showers” will be the case for many on bank holiday Monday, with drier conditions possible in parts of Wales, Northern Ireland and south-west England in the afternoon.
event_breakdown:
- 1inch of rain per hour forecasted to lash parts of England and Wales on May 1st, 2022 - possible flooding, travel delays and power cuts anticipated  
- Met Office has issued a yellow warning for slow-moving showers and thunderstorms over central and northern England and the north east of Wales from midday to 8pm on May 1st, 2022

title: Cyclone Remal to make landfall tonight with 135 kmph winds , coastal areas of Bengal and Bangladesh on high alert
message:
Other models show that the cyclone may hit the coasts by late evening.Remal, which means sand in Arabic, is the first pre-monsoon cyclone in the Bay of Bengal this season.
The name was provided by Oman , following the regional naming system for cyclones in the north Indian Ocean.The Met office has warned of extremely heavy rainfall in the coastal districts of West Bengal and north Odisha on Sunday.
Parts of northeast India may also experience extremely heavy precipitation on May 27-28.A storm surge of up to 1.5 meters is expected to inundate low-lying areas of coastal West Bengal and Bangladesh at the time of landfall.
He mentioned the success of reducing cyclone-related fatalities through initiatives like the National Cyclone Risk Mitigation Project (NCRMP).
“If the cyclone hits here, our soldiers are ready to deal with every kind of disaster...Our team is well-equipped.
event_breakdown:

1. A pre-monsoon cyclone named “Remal” is expected to hit the shores of the Bay of Bengal by late evening.
2. Heavy rainfall is predicted in coastal districts of West Bengal and north Odisha.
3. Parts of northeast India may experience extremely heavy precipitation on May 27-28.
4. A storm surge of up to 1.5 meters is expected inundate low-lying areas of coastal West Bengal and Bangladesh at the time of landfall.
5. Mention of the cyclone hitting the east coast of India and the army being well-prepared to deal with any disasters if it hits.

The forecast stays dry through the evening hours, so any outdoor activities should be safe.
The strongest storms could have some hail and gusty winds, but major severe weather is not expected with this round of storms.
Storms would most likely develop after 4pm, with a few scattered downpours through 8 or 9pm in the evening.

title: Late spring snowstorm blankets southwestern Manitoba , leaving some gardeners scrambling for cover
message:
Brandonites are feeling the aftermath of a strong storm that blanketed the city in wet and heavy snow Friday.
In a Friday afternoon social media post, Manitoba Hydro said it was "dealing with stormy weather and heavy, wet snow, causing outages in areas throughout western/central Manitoba."
Brendon Ehinger moved his Dronescrape event, planned to be held outdoors, inside to the Art Gallery of Southwestern Manitoba.
(Chelsea Kemp/CBC)The rain gave way to heavy snow, and a snowfall warning was issued for Brandon by Environment Canada on Friday afternoon.
Leslie Loader, president of the Brandon Garden Club, says gardeners still have time to start planting their gardens, even if the storm was a setback for some.
event_breakdown:
* Strong storm with wet and heavy snow in Brandon, Manitoba
* Heavy, wet snow causing outages in Manitoba
* Event moved indoors due to stormy weather

title: Severe weather likely Sunday
message:
After a pretty quiet Saturday, we turn our attention to Sunday as severe weather is expected for at least part of the day.
The second line looks to not be an issue until late night, midnight or later.
This second line looks to hold less hail, but have a slightly higher risk for damaging wind and isolated tornadoes.
Please stay weather aware Sunday and have ways to receive watches and warnings throughout the day and if you have outdoor plans, have a plan B.
Eventually, we get the sun back and quiet weather next week as we cool off to the 70s again.

title: Drinkwater Road fire near Spences Bridge in B . C . Interior listed as Being Held
message:
Fire, estimated at 51 hectares, is burning on opposite side of Thompson River from Trans-Canada Hwy.
UPDATE MAY 25: As of the afternoon of Saturday, May 25, the Drinkwater Road wildfire was an estimated 51 hectares and is Being Held, according to the BC Wildfire Service.
According to BCWS, Being Held means ‘A wildfire that is projected, based on fuel and weather conditions and resource availability, to remain within the current perimeter, control line or boundary.’***ORIGINAL STORY: The BC Wildfire Service is responding to a wildfire approximately five kilometres north of Spences Bridge.
It is on the east side of the Thompson River above the CPKC mainline in an area of steep hillside and scattered trees.
Taylor Colman, a fire information officer with the BC Wildfire Service, says that the fire was first reported in the late afternoon of Friday, May 24.
event_breakdown:

- Wildfire northeast of Lytton
